DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text term to identify the imaging technique used for the detection of the biomarker

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tests that produce pictures of areas inside the body.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Objectively measurable phenotypic parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype, presence of biological substances) that characterize an organism's state of health or disease, likelihood of developing a disease, or response to a particular therapeutic intervention.

Concepts.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
